tool.name: DetectUAVChange

param.name: in_project_file
param.dialogReference: Every site has a unique meta.json file in its project folder. Find and select this file to set the current site containing the UAV image you want to generate fraction models for.

param.name: in_uav_from_date
param.dialogReference: Set the "baseline" (i.e., "from") UAV capture date and time.

param.name: in_uav_to_date
param.dialogReference: Set the "to" UAV capture date and time. This will be compared to the "baseline" (i.e., "from") UAV capture image.

param.name: in_use_majority_filter
param.dialogReference: Apply a majority filter using a 5x5 focal window to remove isolated pixels and classification noise.

param.name: in_use_shrink_filter
param.dialogReference: Apply a shrink filter to reduce spatial footprint of pixels by up to 1 pixel. This algorithm greatly reduces the "salt and pepper" noise effect but may also eliminate smaller, valid changes. Recommended if you want to focus on larger, more significant changes.

tool.summary: Perform a categorical change detection between two classified UAV images captured at different dates. The output will display where Native, Weed and Other classes changed between the two input UAV images. Basic summary statistics area also provided in the geoprocessing messages panel.
